content: side s1 k8 p2tog turn row 3 right side s1 k8 ssk turn repeat these last 2 row until there are 10 stitches left on the sole and 10 stitches left at the toe if you are working magic loop rearrange your stitches so the needle tips are at the other end of your work to the working yarn with the 10 sole sts on one tip and the 10 toe sts on the other if you are using two circulars or dpns make sure the 10 sole stitches are on one needle and the 10 toe sts are on another place the 10 sole stiches on one needle and place the 10 toe stitches on a second needle take the crochet hook and use it to remove the first toe st from its needle leave it on the hook pull the first sole stitch off its needle and through the loop on your hook now pull the next stitch from the toe needle off and through your hook loop then then repeat for the next stitch from the sole needle continue in this way until all the stitches are chained thru each other and you have the last knit stitch on the crochet needle cut your yarn and pull through the loop on the hook to secure the cast off if you work better with visuals here are some good on line tutorials http //tiny cc/russiangrafting and two video links http //tiny cc/russiangraftingvideo1 and http //tiny cc/russiangrafti ngvideo2 weave in ends make 2nd bootie to match block the booties look better if you steam block with something cut and folded to prop up the inside card or rolled up bubble wrap works fine lace bootie - cast on as for a plain hodge but work the lace pattern around the fold down cuff and across the instep the cuff lace is a 6 stitch repeat - so you will have to increase or decrease the stitch count to fit the lace in the lace can be repeated on the center stitches of the instep extension cuff round 1 *p1 yo ssk k2tog yo p1* instep extension center this lace panel o n the round 2 *p1 k4 p1* extension as you work it round 3 *p1 k4 p1* row 1 p1 yo ssk k2tog yo p1 repeat these three rounds four times in total row 2 k1 p4 k1 row 3 p1 k4 p1 row 4 k1 yo ssk p2tog yo k1 row 5 p1 k4 p1 row 2 k1 p4 k1 continue as for plain bootie from the round off the toe of the instep extension section repeat row 2 and 3 9 11 times in total this creates the instep and you will have 9 11 chain loops up each side of the instep extension with full respect to all the hard working and inventive knitters out there i attach the following statement of pattern download use and respect by downloading and using my pattern you agree
